intro: Staurogyne hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy water clover, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is native to wetland and marshy habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. It has a creeping growth habit with stolons that root at the nodes. Staurogyne hirsuta is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality.
